headline: AI's Evolution: A Developer's Reflection on the Shift from 2016's Niche Tech to Today's Mass Adoption
description: A personal reflection on the evolution of AI, comparing the specialized, expert-driven machine learning projects of 2016 with the mass-adopted, user-friendly LLM-powered applications of today. This article explores the key drivers behind AI's progress, from computing costs to the crucial role of accessibility and user interfaces.

mainEntity.name: What was the main difference between AI in 2016 and AI today?

acceptedAnswer.text: In 2016, AI was a highly specialized field primarily used by domain experts in areas like bioinformatics and FinTech. It required clean, structured training data and complex implementations. In contrast, AI today, largely driven by Large Language Models (LLMs), is characterized by mass adoption. It features user-friendly interfaces like chatbots that can process unstructured data, making it accessible to a general audience.

mainEntity.name: What was the key factor behind the mass adoption of AI?

acceptedAnswer.text: According to the article, while factors like increased optimization and lower computing costs were important, the primary driver for mass adoption was the convenience provided by new, user-friendly interfaces. The shift to chat-based interactions powered by LLMs made AI accessible and understandable for everyone, not just domain experts.

mainEntity.name: How has the perception of AI changed since 2016?

acceptedAnswer.text: In 2016, AI was often viewed as a niche, futuristic technology, and its practical applications were sometimes not taken seriously, even within specialized fields. Today, AI is considered a serious business tool and is used everywhere, sometimes even in applications where it isn't strictly necessary. It has moved from the realm of 'dreamers' to a mainstream technology.
